title: Inclusive Digital Learning Environment Design Competency Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device usage skills and elementary-level understanding of social education fields
context.additional_context: Blended Instructional Environment Design Considering Multicultural Learners and Those with Digital Accessibility Needs

learning_goals: Using collaborative learning platforms, learners can design effective interaction strategies among peers with diverse cultural backgrounds.
By applying adaptive learning technologies, learners can propose content customization plans tailored to individual needs (language, accessibility, learning pace).

Through a 3-week project-based assessment, learners can develop an inclusive digital learning scenario reflecting at least three diversity factors (age, language, disability type), including five or more multimodal resources (text/image/audio) and support for English/Korean/Spanish (or one learner-selected language). The scenario must achieve 80%+ in four out of five rubric categories (accessibility, diversity reflection, technology utilization, creativity, practicality).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
